metadata.title: CVE-2022-48749 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/msm/dpu: invalid parameter check in dpu_setup_dspp_pccThe function performs a check on the "ctx" input parameter, however, itis used before the check.Initialize the "base" variable after the sanity check to avoid apossible NULL pointer dereference.Addresses-Coverity-ID: 1493866 ("Null pointer dereference")

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
